extendedIngredients.name: granny smith apple

title: Caramelized Endives with Apples
summary: Caramelized Endives with Apples might be just the side dish you are searching for. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegetarian recipe has 88 calories, 1g of protein, and 6g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4 and costs 72 cents per serving. A mixture of water, granny smith apple—peeled, butter, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. This recipe from Food and Wine has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 40 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 9%, this dish is very bad (but still fixable). Try BRAISED ENDIVES AND APPLES, Caramelized Endives, and Cook the Book: Endives, Apples, and Grapes for similar recipes.
instructions: Carefully tuck 6 apple slices between the leaves in each endive half. In a large skillet, melt the butter in the oil over high heat. Add the endives, cut sides down, and cook over moderate heat until nicely browned, about 6 minutes. Carefully turn the endives. Season with salt and pepper and add the water to the skillet. Cover and simmer over low heat until the endives are tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Uncover and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Serve hot.

steps.step: Carefully tuck 6 apple slices between the leaves in each endive half. In a large skillet, melt the butter in the oil over high heat.

Add the endives, cut sides down, and cook over moderate heat until nicely browned, about 6 minutes. Carefully turn the endives. Season with salt and pepper and add the water to the skillet. Cover and simmer over low heat until the endives are tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Uncover and cook until the liquid has evaporated.
